column4: you'll want to make sure you create users with the same usernames/uids as before, so their homdirs and ownership will match up
can I copy the password file from my old install?
hmm.... haven't tried that... i wouldn't expect it to work.  at the very lest you'd need /etc/passwd /etc/shadow, /etc/group
do you have a lot of users?  if not, you could just recreate them manually
well I only have a few but I don't know their passwords
thanks... I have one more question, does ubuntu server come with X?
doesn't install X out of box, but you can apt-get install anything
so apt-get install x.org and all is installed?
not sure.... you'll probably need a bit more than that
someone mentioned earlier a guide for running the server install with a gui.  not sure which package/packages you need to get a minimal gui
maybe ask google "ubuntu server gui"?  also check the wiki, and possibly howtoforge
